intro: Cyclobalanopsis × takaoyamensis var. yokohamensis, commonly known as the Yokohama takaoyamensis chinquapin, is a hybrid evergreen tree native to the warm temperate regions of Japan. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one to three seeds, typical of the genus Cyclobalanopsis. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mixed forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
